But I will be back on Sunday.
But she already has a boyfriend.
Do you know where his key is?
Do you know where his ticket is?
And her credit card is also gone.
words.lithuanian: Jos kreditinė kortelė taip pat dingo.

words.english: Where has he left his glasses?
The clock hangs on the wall.
The children cannot find their parents.
How was your trip, Mr. Miller?
words.lithuanian: Kaip jums sekėsi kelionė, pone Miuleri?

words.english: Where is your wife, Mr. Miller?
How was your trip, Mrs. Smith?
words.lithuanian: Kaip jums sekėsi kelionė, ponia Šmit?

words.english: Where is your husband, Mrs. Smith?
70 years ago he was still young.
words.lithuanian: Prieš septyniasdešimt metų jis buvo dar jaunas.

words.english: A woman who weighs a hundred kilos is fat.
A man who weighs fifty kilos is thin.
I want to make a call.
I want to send an email.
Is there a sheet of paper and a pen here?
words.lithuanian: Ar čia yra lapas popieriaus ir šratinukas?

words.english: Would you like to go for a walk?
I want to relax a little.
I want to ask you something.
I want to ask you for something.
I want to treat you to something.
Or do you prefer a tea?
They want to make a call.
What do you want to do?
Do you want to play football / soccer (am.)?
Do you want to visit friends?
I don’t want to arrive late.
I don’t want to go there.
I want to stay at home.
Do you want to stay here?
Do you want to eat here?
Do you want to sleep here?
Do you want to leave tomorrow?
Do you want to stay till tomorrow?
Do you want to pay the bill only tomorrow?
Do you want to go to the disco?
Do you want to go to the cinema?
Do you want to go to a café?

topic: 72 to have to do something / must

words.lithuanian: (Aš) / turiu / Man reikia sumokėti už viešbutį.

words.english: He must fuel / get petrol / get gas (am.).
words.lithuanian: Jis turi / Jam reikia prisipilti degalų.
Jis turi / Jam reikia suremontuoti automobilį.
Jis turi / Jam reikia nuplauti automobilį.
Ji turi / Jai reikia tvarkyti butą.
Ji turi / Jai reikia skalbti skalbinius.

words.english: We must go to school at once.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) tuoj turime / Mums reikia eiti į mokyklą.

words.english: We must go to work at once.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) tuoj turime / Mums reikia eiti į darbą.

words.english: We must go to the doctor at once.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) tuoj turime / Mums reikia eiti pas gydytoją.

words.english: You must wait for the bus.
You must wait for the train.
You must wait for the taxi.
Are you already allowed to drive?
words.lithuanian: Ar tau jau galima vairuoti automobilį?

words.english: Are you already allowed to drink alcohol?
words.lithuanian: Ar tau jau galima gerti alkoholį?

words.english: Are you already allowed to travel abroad alone?
words.lithuanian: Ar tau jau galima vienam važiuoti į užsienį?

words.english: May one pay by credit card?
May one pay by cheque / check (am.)?
May one only pay in cash?
May I just make a call?
He is not allowed to sleep in the park.
He is not allowed to sleep in the car.
He is not allowed to sleep at the train station.
The pictures are on the CD.
The pictures are in the camera.
Can you clean the pants / trousers?
Do you have a match or a lighter?
I am not coming because the weather is so bad.
He isn’t coming because he isn’t invited.
I am not coming because I have no time.

words.lithuanian: (Aš) dar turiu / Man dar reikia dirbti.

words.english: I am not staying because I still have to work.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nepasilieku, nes dar turiu / man dar reikia dirbti.

words.english: I’m going because it is already late.
I didn’t come because I was ill.
She didn’t come because she was tired.
He didn’t come because he wasn’t interested.
We didn’t come because our car is damaged.
They didn’t come because they missed the train.
words.lithuanian: Jie neatėjo, nes pavėlavo į traukinį.

words.english: I didn’t come because I was not allowed to.
Why aren’t you eating the cake?
I’m not eating it because I must lose weight.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nevalgau, nes turiu / man reikia numesti svorį.

words.english: Why aren’t you drinking the beer?

words.lithuanian: (Aš) dar turėsiu / Man dar reikės važiuoti.

words.english: I’m not drinking it because I have to drive.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) negeriu, nes dar turėsiu / man dar reikės važiuoti.

words.english: Why aren’t you drinking the coffee?
I’m not drinking it because it is cold.
words.lithuanian: Aš jos negeriu, nes ji atšalo / yra šalta.

words.english: Why aren’t you drinking the tea?
I’m not drinking it because I don’t have any sugar.
words.lithuanian: Aš jos negeriu, nes neturiu cukraus.

words.english: Why aren’t you eating the soup?
I’m not eating it because I didn’t order it.
Why don’t you eat the meat?
I’m not eating it because I am a vegetarian.
words.lithuanian: Aš jos nevalgau, nes esu vegetar-as / -ė.

words.english: I am wearing a blue dress.
I am wearing a red dress.
I am wearing a green dress.
An old lady lives at the top.
A fat lady lives at the top.
But the neighbours have naughty children.
He is staying in a hotel.
He is staying in a cheap hotel.
He is reading a boring novel.
She is watching an exciting movie.
She took a piece of chocolate.
He was disloyal, but she was loyal.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo neištikimas, bet ji buvo ištikima.

words.english: He was lazy, but she was hard-working.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo tinginys, bet ji buvo darbšti.

words.english: He was poor, but she was rich.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo neturtingas, bet ji buvo turtinga.

words.english: He had no money, only debts.
words.lithuanian: Jis turėjo ne pinigų, o skolų.

words.english: He had no luck, only bad luck.
He had no success, only failure.
He was not satisfied, but dissatisfied.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo ne patenkintas, o nepatenkintas.

words.english: He was not happy, but sad.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo ne laimingas, o nelaimingas.

words.english: He was not friendly, but unfriendly.
words.lithuanian: Jis buvo ne simpatiškas, o nesimpatiškas.

words.english: Did you have to call an ambulance?
words.lithuanian: Ar tau reikėjo iškviesti greitąją pagalbą?

words.english: Did you have to call the doctor?
Did you have to call the police?
Do you have the telephone number? I had it just now.
words.lithuanian: Ar (jūs) turite telefono numerį? Ką tik (aš) jį turėjau.

words.english: Do you have the address? I had it just now.
words.lithuanian: Ar (jūs) turite adresą? Ką tik (aš) jį turėjau.

words.english: Do you have the city map? I had it just now.
words.lithuanian: Ar (jūs) turite miesto planą? Ką tik (aš) jį turėjau.

words.english: Did he come on time? He could not come on time.
words.lithuanian: Ar jis atvyko / atėjo laiku? Jis negalėjo atvykti / ateiti laiku.

words.english: Did he find the way? He could not find the way.
words.lithuanian: Ar jis rado kelią? Jis negalėjo rasti kelio / Jis nerado kelio.

words.english: Did he understand you? He could not understand me.
words.lithuanian: Ar jis tave suprato? Jis negalėjo manęs suprasti / Jis manęs nesuprato.

words.english: Why could you not come on time?
Why could you not find the way?
words.lithuanian: Kodėl (tu) negalėjai rasti kelio / Kodėl neradai kelio?

words.english: Why could you not understand him?
words.lithuanian: Kodėl (tu) negalėjai jo suprasti / Kodėl jo nesupratai?

words.english: I could not come on time because there were no buses.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) negalėjau atvykti laiku, nes nevažiavo autobusas.

words.english: I could not find the way because I had no city map.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) neradau / negalėjau rasti kelio, nes neturėjau miesto plano.

words.english: I could not understand him because the music was so loud.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nesupratau / negalėjau jo suprasti, nes muzika buvo labai garsi.

words.english: I had to take a taxi.
I had to buy a city map.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) turėjau / Man reikėjo nusipirkti miesto planą.

words.english: I had to switch off the radio.
I was talking on the phone all the time.
I know that – I knew that.
I write that – I wrote that.
I hear that – I heard that.
I’ll get it – I got it.
I’ll bring that – I brought that.
I’ll buy that – I bought that.
I expect that – I expected that.
words.lithuanian: Aš to tikiuosi – aš to tikėjausi.

words.english: I’ll explain that – I explained that.
I know that – I knew that.
How did you pass the exam?
How did you find the way?
With whom did you make an appointment?
With whom did you celebrate your birthday?
What did you come to know?
Which newspaper did you subscribe to?
Why did you become a teacher?
Why did you take a taxi?
We had to water the flowers.
words.lithuanian: Mes turėjome / Mums reikėjo palaistyti gėles.

words.english: We had to clean the apartment.
words.lithuanian: Mes turėjome / Mums reikėjo sutvarkyti butą.

words.english: We had to wash the dishes.
words.lithuanian: Mes turėjome / Mums reikėjo suplauti indus.

words.english: Did you have to pay the bill?
words.lithuanian: Ar (jūs) turėjote / jums reikėjo apmokėti sąskaitą?

words.english: Did you have to pay an entrance fee?
Did you have to pay a fine?
words.lithuanian: Ar (jūs) turėjote / jums reikėjo sumokėti baudą?

words.english: Who had to go home early?
words.lithuanian: Kas turėjo / Kam reikėjo anksti eiti namo?

words.english: Who had to take the train?
words.lithuanian: Kas turėjo / Kam reikėjo važiuoti traukiniu?

words.english: We did not want to stay long.
We did not want to drink anything.
We did not want to disturb you.
I just wanted to make a call.
I just wanted to call a taxi.
Actually I wanted to drive home.
I thought you wanted to call your wife.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) maniau, kad ketinai paskambinti savo žmonai.

words.english: I thought you wanted to call information.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) maniau, kad ketinai paskambinti į informaciją.

words.english: I thought you wanted to order a pizza.
My son did not want to play with the doll.
words.lithuanian: Mano sūnus nenorėjo žaisti su lėle.

words.english: My daughter did not want to play football / soccer (am.).
My wife did not want to play chess with me.
words.lithuanian: Mano žmona nenorėjo su manimi žaisti šachmatais.

words.english: My children did not want to go for a walk.
They did not want to tidy the room.
They did not want to go to bed.
He was not allowed to eat ice cream.
He was not allowed to eat chocolate.
He was not allowed to eat sweets.
I was allowed to make a wish.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) galėjau / man buvo galima / man leido ko nors pageidauti.

words.english: I was allowed to buy myself a dress.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) galėjau / man buvo galima / man leido nusipirkti suknelę.

words.english: I was allowed to take a chocolate.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) galėjau / man buvo galima / man leido paimti saldainį.

words.english: Were you allowed to smoke in the airplane?
words.lithuanian: Ar (tu) galėjai / ar tau buvo galima / tau leido rūkyti lėktuve?

words.english: Were you allowed to drink beer in the hospital?
words.lithuanian: Ar (tu) galėjai / ar tau buvo galima / tau leido ligoninėje gerti alų?

words.english: Were you allowed to take the dog into the hotel?
words.lithuanian: Ar (tu) galėjai / ar tau buvo galima / tau leido pasiimti šunį į viešbutį?

words.english: During the holidays the children were allowed to remain outside late.
words.lithuanian: Per atostogas vaikai galėjo / vaikams buvo galima / vaikams leido ilgai būti lauke.

words.english: They were allowed to play in the yard for a long time.
words.lithuanian: Jie galėjo / jiems buvo galima / jiems leido ilgai žaisti kieme.

words.english: They were allowed to stay up late.
words.lithuanian: Jie galėjo / jiems buvo galima / jiems leido ilgai neiti miegoti.

words.english: You are so lazy – don’t be so lazy!
words.lithuanian: Tu toks tinginys – nebūk toks tinginys!

words.english: You sleep for so long – don’t sleep so late!
words.lithuanian: Tu taip ilgai miegi – nemiegok taip ilgai!

words.english: You come home so late – don’t come home so late!
words.lithuanian: Tu taip vėlai pareini – nepareik taip vėlai!

words.english: You laugh so loudly – don’t laugh so loudly!
words.lithuanian: Tu taip garsiai juokiesi – nesijuok taip garsiai!

words.english: You speak so softly – don’t speak so softly!
words.lithuanian: Tu taip tyliai kalbi – nekalbėk taip tyliai!

words.english: You drink too much – don’t drink so much!
words.lithuanian: Tu per daug geri – negerk tiek daug!

words.english: You smoke too much – don’t smoke so much!
words.lithuanian: Tu per daug rūkai – nerūkyk tiek daug!

words.english: You work too much – don’t work so much!
words.lithuanian: Tu per daug dirbi – nedirbk tiek daug!

words.english: You drive too fast – don’t drive so fast!
words.lithuanian: Tu taip greitai važiuoji – nevažiuok taip greitai!

words.english: Perhaps the weather will get better tomorrow.
I hope that it gets better.
Do you know that for sure?
I think that it is old.

words.lithuanian: (Aš) manau, kad jis net labai gerai atrodo.

words.english: The boss definitely has a girlfriend.
It is very possible that he has a girlfriend.
words.lithuanian: Gali būti, kad jis turi draugę.

words.english: I’m angry that you drink so much beer.
words.lithuanian: Mane erzina, kad (tu) geri tiek daug alaus.

words.english: I’m angry that you come so late.
words.lithuanian: Mane erzina, kad (tu) pareini taip vėlai.

words.english: I think he needs a doctor.
I think he is sleeping now.
We hope that he marries our daughter.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) tikimės, kad jis ves mūsų dukterį.

words.english: We hope that he has a lot of money.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) tikimės, kad jis turi daug pinigų.

words.english: We hope that he is a millionaire.
I heard that your wife had an accident.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) girdėjau, kad tavo žmona pateko į avariją.

words.english: I heard that she is in the hospital.
I heard that your car is completely wrecked.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) girdėjau, kad tavo automobilis visiškai sugedo.

words.english: I’m happy that you are interested.
I’m happy that you want to buy the house.
words.lithuanian: Džiugu / džiaugiuosi, kad (jūs) norite pirkti namą.

words.english: I’m afraid the last bus has already gone.
words.lithuanian: Bijau, kad paskutinis autobusas jau nuvažiavęs.

words.english: I’m afraid we will have to take a taxi.
words.lithuanian: Bijau, kad mums reikės važiuoti taksi.

words.english: I’m afraid I have no more money.
I don’t know if he loves me.
I don’t know if he’ll come back.
I don’t know if he’ll call me.
I wonder if he thinks about me.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) svarstau / spėlioju, ar jis apie mane galvoja.

words.english: I wonder if he has someone else.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) svarstau / spėlioju, ar jis turi kitą.
Kažin, ar jis apie mane galvoja?

words.english: Maybe he tells me the truth?
I doubt whether he really likes me.
I doubt whether he’ll write to me.
I doubt whether he’ll marry me.

words.lithuanian: Kažin, ar tikrai aš jam patinku?

words.english: I’ll wait until my hair is dry.
I’ll wait until the film is over.
I’ll wait until the traffic light is green.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) palauksiu, kol užsidegs žalia šviesoforo šviesa.

words.english: When do you go on holiday?
Yes, before the summer holidays begin.
words.lithuanian: Taip, dar prieš prasidedant vasaros atostogoms.

words.english: Repair the roof before the winter begins.
words.lithuanian: Sutaisyk stogą, kol dar neprasidėjo žiema.

words.english: Wash your hands before you sit at the table.
words.lithuanian: Prieš sėsdamas prie stalo nusiplauk rankas.

words.english: Close the window before you go out.
Yes, after the class is over.
words.lithuanian: Taip, kai baigsis pamokos / pasibaigus pamokoms.

words.english: After he had an accident, he could not work anymore.
words.lithuanian: Po avarijos / po to, kai pateko į avariją, / jis nebegalėjo dirbti.

words.english: After he had lost his job, he went to America.
After he went to America, he became rich.
Since when is she no longer working?
Yes, she is no longer working since she got married.
words.lithuanian: Ji nebedirba nuo tada, kai ištekėjo.

words.english: Since she got married, she’s no longer working.
words.lithuanian: Nuo tada, kai ištekėjo, ji nebedirba.

words.english: Since they have met each other, they are happy.
words.lithuanian: Nuo tada, kai vienas kitą pažįsta, jie yra laimingi.

words.english: Since they have had children, they rarely go out.
words.lithuanian: Nuo tada, kai turi vaikų, jie išena tik retkarčiais.
Taip, kai važiuos / važiuoja / važiuodama / automobiliu.
Ji skambins / skambina, kai važiuos / važiuoja / važiuodama / automobiliu.

words.english: She watches TV while she irons.
words.lithuanian: Ji žiūri televizorių lygindama /, kai lygina.

words.english: She listens to music while she does her work.
I can’t see anything when I don’t have glasses.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nieko nematau, kai / jei / neužsidedu akinių.

words.english: I can’t understand anything when the music is so loud.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nieko nesuprantu, kai taip garsiai groja muzika.

words.english: I can’t smell anything when I have a cold.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nieko neužuodžiu, kai / jei / turiu slogą / sloguoju.

words.english: We’ll take a taxi if it rains.
We’ll travel around the world if we win the lottery.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) keliausime aplink pasaulį, jei laimėsime / išlošime loterijoje.

words.english: We’ll start eating if he doesn’t come soon.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) pradėsim valgyti, jei jis greit nepareis.

words.english: I get up as soon as the alarm rings.
I become tired as soon as I have to study.
words.lithuanian: Kai tik turiu / man reikia mokytis, tuoj pavargstu.

words.english: I will stop working as soon as I am 60.
words.lithuanian: Kai tik man sukaks 60 (šešiasdešimt) metų, liausiuosi dirbti.

words.english: As soon as I have a moment.
He’ll call, as soon as he has a little time.
words.lithuanian: Jis paskambins, kai tik turės šiek tiek laiko.

words.english: I’ll work as long as I can.
I’ll work as long as I am healthy.
He lies in bed instead of working.
She reads the newspaper instead of cooking.
words.lithuanian: Ji skaito laikraštį užuot virusi valgyti.

words.english: He is at the bar instead of going home.
words.lithuanian: Jis sėdi bare / kavinėje užuot ėjęs namo.

words.english: As far as I know, he lives here.
As far as I know, his wife is ill.
As far as I know, he is unemployed.
words.lithuanian: Kiek (aš) žinau, jis neturi darbo / yra bedarbis.

words.english: I overslept; otherwise I’d have been on time.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) pramiegojau, kitaip būčiau atėjęs / atėjusi laiku.

words.english: I missed the bus; otherwise I’d have been on time.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) pavėlavau į autobusą, kitaip būčiau atėjęs / atėjusi laiku.

words.english: I didn’t find the way / I got lost; otherwise I’d have been on time.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) neradau kelio, kitaip būčiau atėjęs / atėjusi laiku.

words.english: He fell asleep although the TV was on.
words.lithuanian: Jis užmigo, nors televizorius buvo įjungtas.

words.english: He stayed a while although it was late.
words.lithuanian: Jis dar pasiliko, nors jau buvo vėlu.

words.english: He didn’t come although we had made an appointment.
words.lithuanian: Jis neatėjo, nors mes buvome susitarę.

words.english: The TV was on. Nevertheless, he fell asleep.
words.lithuanian: Televizorius buvo įjungtas, bet jis vis tiek užmigo.

words.english: It was already late. Nevertheless, he stayed a while.
words.lithuanian: Jau buvo vėlu, bet jis vis tiek dar pasiliko.

words.english: We had made an appointment. Nevertheless, he didn’t come.
words.lithuanian: (Mes) buvome susitarę, bet jis vis tiek neatėjo.

words.english: Although he has no license, he drives the car.
words.lithuanian: Nors jis neturi vairuotojo pažymėjimo, vairuoja automobilį.

words.english: Although the road is slippery, he drives so fast.
words.lithuanian: Nors gatvė yra slidi, jis važiuoja greitai.

words.english: Although he is drunk, he rides his bicycle.
words.lithuanian: Nors jis yra girtas, važiuoja dviračiu.

words.english: Despite having no licence / license (am.), he drives the car.
words.lithuanian: Jis neturi vairuotojo pažymėjimo, bet vis tiek vairuoja automobilį.

words.english: Despite the road being slippery, he drives fast.
words.lithuanian: Gatvė (yra) slidi, bet jis vis tiek važiuoja greitai.

words.english: Despite being drunk, he rides the bike.
words.lithuanian: Jis (yra) girtas, bet vis tiek važiuoja dviračiu.

words.english: Although she went to college, she can’t find a job.
words.lithuanian: Ji neranda darbo, nors turi diplomą.

words.english: Although she is in pain, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
words.lithuanian: Ji neina pas gydytoją, nors jai skauda.

words.english: Although she has no money, she buys a car.
words.lithuanian: Ji perka automobilį, nors neturi pinigų.

words.english: She went to college. Nevertheless, she can’t find a job.
words.lithuanian: Ji turi diplomą, bet vis tiek neranda darbo .

words.english: She is in pain. Nevertheless, she doesn’t go to the doctor.
words.lithuanian: Jai skauda, bet ji vis tiek neina pas gydytoją.

words.english: She has no money. Nevertheless, she buys a car.
words.lithuanian: Ji neturi pinigų, bet vis tiek perka automobilį.

words.english: The journey was beautiful, but too tiring.
words.lithuanian: Kelionė nors / kad ir buvo graži, bet per daug varginanti.

words.english: The train was on time, but too full.
words.lithuanian: Traukinys nors / kad ir atėjo laiku, bet buvo per pilnas.

words.english: The hotel was comfortable, but too expensive.
words.lithuanian: Viešbutis nors / kad ir buvo jaukus, bet per brangus.

words.english: He’ll take either the bus or the train.
words.lithuanian: Jis važiuos arba autobusu, arba traukiniu.

words.english: He’ll come either this evening or tomorrow morning.
words.lithuanian: Jis atvyks arba šiandien vakare, arba rytoj ryte.

words.english: He’s going to stay either with us or in the hotel.
words.lithuanian: Jis gyvens arba pas mus, arba viešbutyje.

words.english: She speaks Spanish as well as English.
words.lithuanian: Ji kalba tiek / ir ispaniškai, tiek / ir angliškai.

words.english: She has lived in Madrid as well as in London.
words.lithuanian: Ji gyveno tiek / ir Madride, tiek / ir Londone.

words.english: She knows Spain as well as England.
words.lithuanian: Ji pažįsta tiek / ir Ispaniją, tiek / ir Angliją.

words.english: He is not only stupid, but also lazy.
words.lithuanian: Jis ne tik kvailas, bet ir tinginys.

words.english: She is not only pretty, but also intelligent.
words.lithuanian: Ji ne tik graži, bet ir protinga.

words.english: She speaks not only German, but also French.
words.lithuanian: Ji kalba ne tik vokiškai, bet ir prancūziškai.

words.english: I can neither play the piano nor the guitar.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nemoku groti nei pianinu, nei gitara.

words.english: I can neither waltz nor do the samba.
words.lithuanian: (Aš) nemoku šokti nei valso, nei sambos.

words.english: I like neither opera nor ballet.
The faster you work, the earlier you will be finished.
words.lithuanian: Kuo greičiau (tu) dirbsi, tuo anksčiau baigsi.

words.english: The earlier you come, the earlier you can go.
words.lithuanian: Kuo anksčiau (tu) ateisi, tuo anksčiau galėsi išeiti.

words.english: The older one gets, the more complacent one gets.
words.lithuanian: Kuo labiau sensti, tuo labiau mėgst patogumą.

words.english: The button from the shirt is gone.
The boss’ computer is not working.
How do I get to her parents’ house?
words.lithuanian: Kaip man atvykti į jūsų tėvų namus?

words.english: The house is at the end of the road.
What is the name of the capital city of Switzerland?
What is the title of the book?
What are the names of the neighbour’s / neighbor’s (am.) children?
What are the doctor’s consultation times?
What time is the museum open?
Have you already been to Berlin?
No, I don’t know anyone here.
a little longer – not much longer
Will you stay here a little longer?
No, I won’t stay here much longer.
words.lithuanian: Ne, (aš) čia jau ilgai nebūsiu / būsiu čia nebeilgai.

words.english: Would you like to drink something else?
words.lithuanian: Ar norėtumėte dar ko nors išgerti?

words.english: No, I don’t want anything else.
words.lithuanian: Ne, (aš) daugiau nieko nenoriu / nieko nebenoriu.

words.english: No, I haven’t eaten anything yet.
Does anyone else want a coffee?
